result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon J.A. Jobe

Defendant Devon J.A. Jobe in  Court.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in Court for Devon J.A. Jobe.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have NOT reached a resolution in this matter. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 09:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Jury Trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 14, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Devon J.A. Jobe in Court.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad appeared by video for Devon J.A. Jobe.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in resolution posture; however, Defense requested an adjournment. State did not object. Court granted Defense request. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea hearing, Branch 46. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court LOWERED Cash Bail to $15,000.00. Court ordered $10,000.00 Cash Bail RETURNED to the person who posted it.
All previously ordered conditions of Bail remain.

Defendant Devon J.A. Jobe in Court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Modify Bail.

Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Court ordered Defense and State to meet/talk at least 48 hours in advance of the next hearing. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. 
Status hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Court adjourns case for an additional Scheduling Conference due to attorney Corr being unavailable. Case adjourned to Br 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated April 27, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Devon J.A. Jobe in court with attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. State to provide Defense counsel with discovery material and an offer via digital system. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46. Court advised Defendant to continue compliance with JusticePoint. Scheduling Conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 8:30am. Hearing will be held via/Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Devon J.A. Jobe in court with attorney Amy C Scholz, as friend of the court.  Defendant Devon J.A. Jobe in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devon J.A. Jobe appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
